alert.note: Alert for Lucas; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:49PM EST until February 21 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. Sandusky River At Tiffin affecting Seneca County. Huron River Near Milan affecting Erie County. Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County. Chagrin River At Willoughby affecting Lake County. Grand River At Painesville affecting Lake County. Blanchard River Near Findlay affecting Hancock County. Nimishillen Creek Near North Industry affecting Stark County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Scioto River Near Larue affecting Marion County. Maumee River At Waterville affecting Wood and Lucas Counties. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sandusky River...including Fremont, Upper Sandusky, Tiffin, Bucyrus...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Huron River...including Milan...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Elyria...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chagrin River...including Willoughby...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Grand River...including Painesville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blanchard River...including Findlay...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Scioto River...including Larue, Prospect...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station, Findlay...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maumee River At Waterville. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding begins in Side Cut Metropark. The river is out of banks in Waterville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 02/02/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 1100 AM EST.
